title: An unexpected error has occurred while logging in
body: I've been trying to log in for about Three Days now, and I continue to get this message, I have firewall disabled, and my antivirus paused, league of legends is allowed. I've done all of the Networking tips to Log in, I have done a full reinstall, and have done hextech repairs, but, the hextech repair system crashes every time it is about to complete. STILL to this point I have had infinite authenticating. Please Help.

replies.body: I am also having the same problem. Any easy way to fix this matter?"an unexpected error has occurred while logging in "

I can not play because this problem bothered me. Is there a solution or what?
"an unexpected error has occurred while logging in "

Yes it looks like most of us that are getting routed through Denver's node are unable to authenticate to the League client. The area is still experiencing problems as I ran a trace route last night and got 90% of my packets dropped. 

The temporary work around is to use a VPN and re-route the connection around that node.

I've been noticing quite a few login issues today, and I've been told by a couple players that some of it might in fact be caused by some kind of issue with ISP's. I want to go ahead and take a look at what your connection is looking like after it leaves your network, so let's run a trace route to our NA server at 104.160.131.1 using something like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/). Paste a screenshot here if you can so I can take a look with you!
Having this same problem. also trying to connect from the denver area.  No other internet issues, just with LOL.

Same issue here still... The last thread it looked like we narrowed down the issue to it being linked to being routed through Denver. But apparently it's still messed up despite that all. We'll see if it gets sorted soon. Can't really do anything on our side, my ISP says there's nothing they can do either.
